info:
Formation: Imperfect (preterite) tense of the auxiliary verb "haben" or "sein" + past participle of the main verb.
Example: "Ich hatte gegessen" (I had eaten).
Usage: Denotes an action that was completed before another past action. Verbs indicating movement or change of state use "sein" as the auxiliary.
native_answer: By the time we arrived, she had already left on a trip.
